Package de.hshl.obj.wavefront.parse

Class Resource

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.hshl.obj.wavefront.parse.Resource
  • public final class Resource
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains a path to a file separated into (A) the environment where to find related files and (B) the name of a file in that environment.

    Use local(Path) or absolute(Path) if you want to open a file-based resource.

    See Also:
    getEnvironment(), getName(), getFilePath()

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static interface  Resource.Environment
      A Environment is able to open a resource by name.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Resource​(Resource.Environment environment, java.lang.String name)
      Construct a new Resource.

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static Resource absolute​(java.nio.file.Path path)
      Create a new Resource to an external absolute file path.
      Resource.Environment getEnvironment()
      The environment which contains all related files
      java.nio.file.Path getFilePath()
      If this Resource is made from a file in a folder, returns the file path.
      java.lang.String getName()
      The name of the file inside the environment of all related files
      static Resource local​(java.nio.file.Path path)
      Create a new Resource to a file which is inside your jar, or an external file relative to your jar.
      java.io.BufferedReader open()
      Open the resource with a buffered reader.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Resource

        public Resource​(Resource.Environment environment,
                java.lang.String name)
        Construct a new Resource. Use local(Path) or absolute(Path) if you want to open a file-based resource, instead of using this constructor.
        Parameters:
        environment - See getName()
        name - See getEnvironment()

    • Method Detail

      • open

        public java.io.BufferedReader open()
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Open the resource with a buffered reader.
        Returns:
        An open reader which has to be closed by the caller.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the resource cannot be opened.

      • getFilePath

        public java.nio.file.Path getFilePath()
        If this Resource is made from a file in a folder, returns the file path. Note however that this Path does not remember whether it references a local resource or an absolute file.

        Use open() instead if you want to open the file regardless of whether it is local or absolute.

      • local

        public static Resource local​(java.nio.file.Path path)
        Create a new Resource to a file which is inside your jar, or an external file relative to your jar.
        Parameters:
        path - The file path of the resource
        Returns:
        The resource of the file
        See Also:
        absolute(Path)

      • absolute

        public static Resource absolute​(java.nio.file.Path path)
        Create a new Resource to an external absolute file path. Use local(Path) instead if you want to open a file inside your jar or an external file relative to your jar.
        Parameters:
        path - The file path of the resource
        Returns:
        The resource of the file

      • getEnvironment

        public Resource.Environment getEnvironment()
        The environment which contains all related files

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        The name of the file inside the environment of all related files
